edu.cpp.cs.cs141.assignment2

Class Gun

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.assignment2.Gun

  • public class Gun
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the Gun, which is the weapon held by an ActiveAgent.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Gun(java.lang.String type)
      This is the constructor for the class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getAmmo()
      This method returns a String represention of ammo as a ratio with a combination of the number of rounds left (ammo), a slash, and the maximum number of rounds the Gun can hold (maxAmmo).
      java.lang.String getWeaponType()
      This method retrieves the type of weapon assigned to weaponType and returns it.
      boolean isEmpty()
      The method checks if the weapon is empty
      void loadWeapon()
      This method assigns the right enum constant to maxAmmo and assigns its value to ammo based on the type of weapon in order to "load the weapon"
      void reload()
      This method refills ammo all the way to its max value based on weaponType
      void setWeaponAccuracy()
      This method creates 100 nodes of Boolean type.
      boolean shoot(ActiveAgent agent)
      This method allows one ActiveAgent to shoot another ActiveAgent.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Gun

        public Gun(java.lang.String type)
        This is the constructor for the class. It sets the weaponType to the value passed in the parameter and loads the weapon as well as setting its accuracy.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of gun chosen or randomly given to the ActiveAgent

    • Method Detail

      • loadWeapon

        public void loadWeapon()
        This method assigns the right enum constant to maxAmmo and assigns its value to ammo based on the type of weapon in order to "load the weapon"

      • setWeaponAccuracy

        public void setWeaponAccuracy()
        This method creates 100 nodes of Boolean type. It fills the list with a certain number of true and false values based on the percentage accuracy of the weapon. It then shuffles the list three times.

      • reload

        public void reload()
        This method refills ammo all the way to its max value based on weaponType

      • shoot

        public boolean shoot(ActiveAgent agent)
        This method allows one ActiveAgent to shoot another ActiveAgent. If the calling agent has ammo and gets a "hit" (true) out of the weaponAccuracy list, the target agent "takes damage" via the ActiveAgent.takeDamage(int) method based on weaponType. One ammo is deducted whether it's "hit" or "miss". Returns true if "hit" and false if "miss".
        Parameters:
        agent - The target agent that the calling agent wants to shoot.
        Returns:
        true if "hit", false if "miss".

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        The method checks if the weapon is empty
        Returns:
        true if empty, false if not empty.

      • getWeaponType

        public java.lang.String getWeaponType()
        This method retrieves the type of weapon assigned to weaponType and returns it.
        Returns:
        The type of weapon in String format

      • getAmmo

        public java.lang.String getAmmo()
        This method returns a String represention of ammo as a ratio with a combination of the number of rounds left (ammo), a slash, and the maximum number of rounds the Gun can hold (maxAmmo).
        Returns:
        String ratio of ammo and maxAmmo
